intro: Monotagma guianense, commonly known as the Guianese monotagma, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth, glossy surface. Monotagma guianense is often found growing near streams and in humid, shaded environments.
